integrations_researched.name: Next.js

api_patterns.initialization: npx create-next-app@latest with --yes flag includes TypeScript, Tailwind, ESLint, App Router, and Turbopack

gotchas: App Router is the default (not Pages Router)
Server Components are the default - add 'use client' for client-side interactivity
Turbopack is now the default bundler
Import alias @/* is configured by default

integrations_researched.name: Tailwind CSS

key_functions: Custom color configuration via CSS variables or theme
Dark mode support (class or media strategy)
Responsive design with breakpoint prefixes (sm:, md:, lg:, xl:, 2xl:)

gotchas: Tailwind v4 uses @import instead of @tailwind directives
Uses @tailwindcss/postcss plugin (not tailwindcss directly in postcss config)
postcss.config.mjs (not .js) for ESM syntax
Custom colors for dark mossy green and carbon fiber textures will need custom CSS/theme extension

integrations_researched.name: Framer Motion / Motion

verified_package.name: motion
verified_package.note: Motion is the successor to Framer Motion - same team, same API

api_patterns.initialization: Wrap elements with motion.div or other motion components
key_functions: whileInView - Trigger animations when element enters viewport
transition prop - Control timing and easing
useTransform - Transform scroll values to animation values
api_patterns.verified_against: Context7 MCP resolution confirmed library exists

gotchas: Requires 'use client' directive in Next.js App Router components
Motion is the newer package name (same creators as framer-motion)
useInView and whileInView are excellent for scroll-triggered fade-ins
For parallax effects, combine useScroll with useTransform

integrations_researched.name: GSAP (GreenSock Animation Platform)

key_functions: gsap.fromTo() - Animate from start to end
api_patterns.verified_against: Context7 MCP resolution confirmed library exists

gotchas: Must register plugins with gsap.registerPlugin() before use
ScrollTrigger is perfect for parallax effects
Use useGSAP hook in React for proper cleanup (avoids memory leaks)
Some premium plugins require GreenSock license (ScrollSmoother, SplitText)
Free plugins: ScrollTrigger, Flip, Draggable are free for most uses

integrations_researched.name: React

imports: 'use client' // Required for client components in Next.js App Router

gotchas: Server Components (default in Next.js) cannot use hooks
Add 'use client' at top of file for client-side interactivity
React 19 introduces new features like use() hook

integrations_researched.name: TypeScript

api_patterns.initialization: Included by default with Next.js setup
key_functions: Type annotations for props and state
Type safety for portfolio item filtering

gotchas: Type definitions included by default with Next.js
Use .tsx extension for React components
Path aliases configured in tsconfig.json (@/*)

unverified_claims.claim: LinkedIn API integration for bio data pull
unverified_claims.reason: Requirements mention pulling data from LinkedIn for Nicolas Robert Myers. LinkedIn's public API has strict limitations and OAuth requirements. Manual content extraction is more practical.
unverified_claims.recommendation: Manually curate bio content rather than attempting LinkedIn API integration

unverified_claims.reason: Specific implementation approach not researched - could be CSS background patterns, SVG textures, or image assets
unverified_claims.recommendation: Use CSS repeating patterns or subtle SVG textures for performance

recommendations.recommendation: Use Motion (Framer Motion) as primary animation library for fade-ins, transitions, and viewport-triggered animations. Reserve GSAP for complex parallax effects if needed.
recommendations.rationale: Motion has excellent React integration and is easier to use for most animations. GSAP excels at complex timeline-based animations and parallax.

recommendations.recommendation: Use 'npx create-next-app@latest --yes' for quickest setup with all recommended defaults (TypeScript, Tailwind, ESLint, App Router, Turbopack)
recommendations.rationale: This includes all required technologies in one command

recommendations.recommendation: Extend Tailwind CSS with custom colors for dark mossy green palette in tailwind.config.js or CSS variables. Create reusable component styles.
recommendations.rationale: Maintains consistency and allows easy theme customization

recommendations.recommendation: Implement client-side filtering with React state - no external library needed for simple category filtering
recommendations.rationale: Simple category filtering doesn't require additional dependencies

recommendations.recommendation: Use Next.js Image component for all images, lazy-load portfolio items, and implement scroll-triggered animations to reduce initial load
recommendations.rationale: Core Web Vitals are critical for portfolio sites
